title: Can an electric acoustic bass replace an electric bass? - Quora

response.answer_text: Technically, yes. They are usually tuned the same. But there are major differences that you should consider before any purchase. Electric basses don't have the feedback issues that Acoustic basses have. Especially in loud rock band situations. And electric basses are much easier to transport. The electric bass also has different types of pickups ( generally) where as an acoustic upright has an aftermarket “ transducer” installed The acoustic upright bass also can be bowed. Now, if you are referring to an acoustic “ Guitar body” style of bass the feedback issues might be diminished some, and the transportability is much easier to deal with, but you are still dealing with a “ transducer” pickup as opposed to a “humbucker” or Coil pickup that is much more friendly to loud volume situations than a transducer. And though they may be portable ( the “guitar body” Style acoustic bass,) I have yet to hear one that, (when played strictly acoustically ) has any decent tonality versus an upright acoustic bass.

In my experience the amplification of an acoustic bass (NOT an upright) is problematic in a band situation. They just don’t seem to have enough cut through to mix well. It’s tough to compete against a drum set and/or an electric guitar going through a serious amp.
Not really, no. Electric basses have better construction, they're much less cumbersome, and they sound the same if not better. Electro acoustic basses aren't even good at being acoustic.
I do not understand the question… do you mean an acoustic bass guitar with a pickup (Like a Kelly Dragonfly)? If so… sure. For much stuff. But not for all.
